Med prazniki ustavili več pijanih voznikov
05 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Ana Cukijati

Policisti so v minulih prazničnih dneh prestregli kar nekaj mladih voznikov, ki so za volan sedli pod vplivom alkohola in prepovedanih drog. Policisti so dvema začasno odvzeli vozniško dovoljenje, saj sta napihala krepko čez dovoljeno mejo, 31-letnik pa je vozil pod vlivom drog. Nad Izolo pa je domačin trčil v avto in odpeljal naprej, nato pa napihal več kot dva promila.



V Renčah so policisti 31-letnemu vozniku odredili hitri test za odkrivanje vožnje pod vplivom prepovedanih drog. Foto: Leo Caharija

PRIMORSKA > V noči na petek so novogoriški prometni policisti v Šempetru pri Gorici ustavili 23-letnega voznika avtomobila in mu odredili preizkus alkoholiziranosti. Rezultat je pokazal, da je vozil pod vplivom alkohola, saj je imel 0,83 miligrama alkohola v litru izdihanega zraka (1,75 promila).
Čez dve uri so pri kontroli cestnega prometa v Šempetru ustavili še 19-letnega voznika avtomobila. Napihal je 0,86 miligrama alkohola v litru izdihanega zraka (1,8 promila). Policisti so obema kršiteljema prepovedali vožnjo in jima začasno vzeli vozniško dovoljenje, čaka pa ju še srečanje s sodnikom za prekrške, saj so zoper spisali obdolžilni predlog.
V petek popoldne pa so prometni policisti v Renčah ustavili 31-letnega voznika avtomobila in mu zaradi suma, da vozi pod vplivom prepovedanih drog, odredilI hitri test. Ta je bil pozitiven, zato so mu policisti odredili strokovni pregled, vendar ga je odločno odklonil. Tudi njemu policisti niso dovolili, da bi se sam odpeljal naprej, začasno so mu vzeli vozniško dovoljenje in na okrajno sodišče poslali obdolžilni predlog.
V petek ob 23.25 pa je koprski operativno komunikacijski center poklical voznik in prijavil, da je na cesti med Šaredom in Kortami v njegov avto trčil voznik osebnega vozila, nato pa odpeljal naprej. Prijavitelj je zapeljal za njim. Takrat še neznani voznik je ustavil v Kortah, nato pa odpeljal naprej. Policisti so avtu kmalu izsledili, za volanom je sedel 43-letni domačin, ki sploh nima veljavnega vozniškega dovoljenja. Policisti so mu odredili alkotest, ki se je ustavil pri rezultatu 1,12 miligrama alkohola v litru izdihanega zraka (2,33 promila). Avto so 43-letniku zasegli, čaka ga obdolžilni predlog.

Several drunk drivers stopped during the holidays
05 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Ana Cukijati

Police officers intercepted several young drivers who were driving under the influence of alcohol and drugs in the past few days. Police officers temporarily revoked the driver's license as they inflated boldly across the border, while the 31-year-old drove under a drug influx. Above Izola, the local man ran into the car and drove on, then inflated more than two prom.



In Renče, police ordered a 31-year-old driver to be tested for drug-related driving. Photo by Leo Cahari

PRIMORSKA> On Friday night, traffic police officers in Šempeter pri Gorici stopped a 23-year-old car driver and ordered him intoxicated. The result showed that he was under the influence of alcohol as he had 0.83 milligrams of alcohol per liter of exhaled air (1.75 ppm).
Two hours later, a 19-year-old driver of the car was stopped while controlling road traffic in Šempeter. He inflated 0.86 milligrams of alcohol per liter of exhaled air (1.8 ppm). Police officers banned both offenders from driving and temporarily took their driver's license, and a meeting with a misdemeanor judge awaits them, since they wrote a charge sheet against them.
On Friday afternoon, police officers in Renče stopped a 31-year-old driver of a car and ordered him to take a quick test on suspicion of driving under the influence of illicit drugs. This was a positive one and police officers ordered him to be examined, but he declined. The police also did not allow him to drive forward, temporarily took his driver's license and sent a charge sheet to the district court.
On Friday at 23.25, the Koper Operational Communication Center called the driver and reported that a passenger of the passenger car had collided in the road between Shared and Korti and then drove on. The applicant followed him. The then unknown driver stopped in Kortah and then drove on. Police officers soon tracked the car, behind the wheel was a 43-year-old native who did not even have a valid driver's license. Police officers ordered him an alcohol test, which stopped at a result of 1.12 milligrams of alcohol in a liter of exhaled air (2.33 ppm). The car was seized by a 43-year-old man, awaiting a charge sheet.
